docs.title: Bioinformatics Learning Hub
docs.text: Welcome to the comprehensive bioinformatics learning resource. Choose your path based on your experience level.

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• Getting Started - New to bioinformatics? Start here
  • Navigation Guide - Help finding the right learning path

docs.title: 🟢 Beginner Track
docs.text:
Perfect if you're new to bioinformatics or computational biology. Covers biology fundamentals, programming basics, and introductory concepts.

Topics: Biology basics • Programming (Python/R/Bash) • Sequence analysis • File formats • Hands-on tutorials

docs.title: 🟡 Intermediate Track
docs.text:
For those with basic programming and biology knowledge. Focus on real-world analysis workflows and practical applications.

Topics: NGS analysis • Genomics • Transcriptomics • Proteomics • Algorithms • Complete projects

docs.title: 🔴 Advanced Track
docs.text:
Cutting-edge techniques for experienced practitioners. Covers specialized domains, advanced algorithms, and infrastructure.

Topics: Multi-omics • Deep learning • Cancer genomics • Metagenomics • Cloud/HPC • Novel methods

docs.title: Getting Started with Bioinformatics
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you begin your bioinformatics journey, regardless of your background.

docs.title: What is Bioinformatics?
docs.text: Bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary field that combines biology, computer science, mathematics, and statistics to analyze and interpret biological data—particularly large-scale molecular datasets from high-throughput technologies.

docs.title: Core Skill Areas
docs.text:
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│          BIOINFORMATICS SKILL FRAMEWORK                  │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│   BIOLOGY           COMPUTING          QUANTITATIVE     │
│   ───────           ────────           ────────────     │
│   • Molecular Bio   • Linux/Unix       • Statistics    │
│   • Genetics        • Python/R         • Probability   │
│   • Genomics        • SQL              • Linear Algebra│
│   • Cell Biology    • Version Control  • ML/DL         │
│   • Evolution       • Cloud Computing  • Data Viz      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Are you a Beginner?
docs.text:
Start here if: - ✅ New to programming or computational biology - ✅ Limited experience with command line - ✅ Want to understand fundamentals first

→ Start with Beginner Track

docs.title: Are you Intermediate?
docs.text:
You're here if: - ✅ Know basic programming (Python or R) - ✅ Understand molecular biology concepts - ✅ Ready for real-world analysis workflows

→ Jump to Intermediate Track

docs.title: Are you Advanced?
docs.text:
This is for you if: - ✅ Experienced with NGS analysis - ✅ Proficient in multiple languages - ✅ Looking for cutting-edge methods

** → Explore Advanced Track**

docs.title: Phase 1: Foundations (2-3 months)
docs.text:
1. Biology basics - Understand the domain
  2. Programming fundamentals - Learn Python or R
  3. Unix command line - Master the terminal
  4. File formats - FASTA, FASTQ, etc.

docs.title: Phase 2: Core Skills (3-6 months)
docs.text:
1. NGS technologies
  2. RNA-seq analysis
  3. Variant calling
  4. Statistical analysis

docs.title: Phase 3: Specialization (6+ months)
docs.text: Choose a domain: - Genomics → Population genetics - Transcriptomics → Single-cell analysis - Computational → Deep learning - Clinical → Variant interpretation

docs.title: Must-Know Tools (Beginner)
docs.text:
• Python or R - Programming languages
  • Bash/Unix - Command line interface
  • Git - Version control
  • BLAST - Sequence similarity search

docs.title: Important Tools (Intermediate)
docs.text:
• SAMtools - BAM/SAM file manipulation
  • bcftools - VCF file operations
  • FastQC/MultiQC - Quality control
  • BWA/STAR - Read alignment

docs.title: Advanced Tools
docs.text:
• Nextflow/Snakemake - Workflow management
  • Docker/Singularity - Containers
  • Cloud platforms - AWS, Google Cloud, Terra
  • HPC schedulers - Slurm, PBS

docs.title: Free Online Courses
docs.text:
• Coursera: Biology Meets Programming
  • edX: Data Analysis for Life Sciences
  • Galaxy Training

docs.title: Video Tutorials
docs.text:
• Bioinformatics with BB 🎥 - Comprehensive bioinformatics tutorials

See Online Courses for complete list.

docs.title: Practice Platforms
docs.text:
• Rosalind - Bioinformatics problems
  • Galaxy - No-code analysis
  • Sandbox.bio - Browser-based tutorials

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Read the Navigation Guide to find your optimal path
  2. Choose your skill level and start learning
  3. Practice with hands-on tutorials
  4. Join the community forums

Ready to start? Head to the Beginner Track or jump to your level!

Created by: Bioinformatics with BB 🎥

Last Updated: November 2025

docs.text: Deep learning, network biology, systems biology, algorithm optimization

Publication-quality analyses and pipelines

Last Updated: November 2025

docs.title: Beginner Track
docs.text:
Perfect for: Complete beginners, career switchers, undergraduates new to bioinformatics

Start your bioinformatics journey with foundational concepts, programming basics, and hands-on tutorials.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: None! This track is designed for complete beginners with no prior bioinformatics experience.

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text: By completing this track, you will: - ✅ Understand fundamental molecular biology concepts - ✅ Write basic programs in Python, R, and Bash - ✅ Navigate biological databases - ✅ Understand common file formats - ✅ Perform basic sequence analyses

docs.title: Recommended Learning Path
docs.text:
Follow this order for the best learning experience:

1. Foundations (2-4 weeks)
   ↓
2. Computational Skills (4-8 weeks)
   ↓
3. Bioinformatics Introduction (2-4 weeks)
   ↓
4. Hands-on Tutorials (2-4 weeks)

docs.title: 📚 1. Foundations
docs.text:
Understand the biological basis of bioinformatics.

  • Biology Basics - Cells, DNA, RNA, proteins
  • Molecular Biology - Gene expression, regulation
  • Genetics Introduction - Inheritance, variation
  • Central Dogma - DNA → RNA → Protein

Time: 2-4 weeks

docs.title: 💻 2. Computational Skills
docs.text:
Learn essential programming languages for bioinformatics.

  • Programming Basics - Logic, data structures, algorithms
  • Python for Bioinformatics - Biopython, pandas, plotting
  • R Basics - Data analysis, Bioconductor
  • Unix Command Line - Bash, file operations, scripting

Time: 4-8 weeks

docs.title: 🧬 3. Bioinformatics Introduction
docs.text:
Core bioinformatics concepts and tools.

  • What is Bioinformatics - Field overview, applications
  • Sequence Analysis - BLAST, alignment basics
  • Databases Introduction - NCBI, EBI, UniProt navigation
  • File Formats - FASTA, FASTQ, SAM, VCF, BED

Time: 2-4 weeks

docs.title: 🔬 4. Hands-on Tutorials
docs.text:
Practice with real bioinformatics workflows.

  • First BLAST Search - Finding similar sequences
  • NCBI Exploration - Navigate major databases
  • Simple Alignment - Align sequences

Time: 2-4 weeks

docs.title: Learning Tips
docs.text:
Study Strategies

  • Practice daily - Even 30 minutes makes a difference
  • Type, don't copy - Write code yourself to learn
  • Use real data - Download sample datasets and experiment
  • Join communities - Ask questions on Biostars

Common Pitfalls

  • Don't skip the command line - it's essential
  • Don't rush through programming basics
  • Don't try to learn everything at once - focus on one topic

docs.title: Free Courses
docs.text:
• Coursera: Biology Meets Programming
  • Rosalind Python Village
  • Galaxy Training

docs.title: Books
docs.text:
• "Python for Biologists" by Martin Jones
  • "Bioinformatics for Dummies" by Claverie & Notredame
  • "Introduction to Bioinformatics" by Arthur Lesk

See Learning Materials for more.

docs.title: Practice Problems
docs.text: Build your skills with these platforms: - Rosalind - Bioinformatics problem sets - HackerRank - Programming challenges - Galaxy - No-code bioinformatics

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After completing the Beginner Track:

  1. Intermediate Track - Real-world NGS analysis
  2. Choose a Pathway - Specialize in a domain
  3. Explore Tools - Build your toolkit

docs.title: Time Commitment
docs.text:
• Minimum: 10-15 hours/week for 3-6 months
  • Recommended: 20+ hours/week for faster progress
  • Full-time: Can complete in 2-3 months

Ready to begin? Start with Biology Basics!

Last Updated: November 2025

docs.title: Intermediate Track
docs.text: Real-world bioinformatics analyses for those with basic programming and biology knowledge.

docs.title: Sequence Analysis
docs.text: Multiple alignment, phylogenetics, motif finding, HMM profiles

docs.title: Genomics
docs.text: NGS technologies, genome assembly, variant calling, annotation

docs.title: Transcriptomics
docs.text: RNA-seq, differential expression, pathway analysis, single-cell basics

docs.title: Proteomics
docs.text: Protein structure, mass spectrometry, functional annotation

docs.title: Algorithms
docs.text: Dynamic programming, graph algorithms, machine learning intro

docs.title: Practical Projects
docs.text:
Complete RNA-seq pipeline, variant analysis, phylogenetic trees

Next: Advanced Track

Last Updated: November 2025
